meanings.definition: Surround or enclose with a fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer outfenced his land to protect his crops from animals.
meanings.sent2: She outfenced her backyard to create a safe play area for her children.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the outfenced tree but couldn't find a way in.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outfence the garden against intruders was evident in the sturdy barriers he built.
meanings.sent5: The old stone wall outfenced the ancient ruins, preserving their history for generations to come.

meanings.definition: To surpass in fencing or fencing skill.
meanings.sent1: In the competition, he outfenced all his opponents with his swift moves and precise strikes.
meanings.sent2: She trained hard to outfence her rival and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The young fencer was determined to outfence the experienced champion in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outfence his opponents made him a formidable competitor in the fencing arena.
meanings.sent5: The fencer's skillful footwork and quick reflexes allowed him to outfence even the most seasoned adversaries.
